title: Education Costs in Saint Helena
content:
The cost of education in Saint Helena varies, with public schools being generally free or subsidized, while private schools and international institutions charge fees ranging from a few thousand to over ten thousand dollars per year.

[FACTBOX]
Education Spend (% GDP): 10.2
Literacy Rate: 97
School System: 12 years of compulsory education
Academic Year: 12 months
Currency: SHP
[/FACTBOX]

[SECTION] Education System Overview [/SECTION]
The education system in Saint Helena is overseen by the government, with a strong emphasis on providing free or subsidized education to all citizens. The **public education system** is generally considered to be of good quality, with a focus on core subjects such as English, mathematics, and science. The language of instruction is **English**, and students typically attend school for 12 years, starting from the age of 5. While there are no international schools on the island, some students may choose to attend schools in the United Kingdom or other countries for higher education or specialized programs.

The **private education sector** is relatively small, with a few private schools offering primary and secondary education. These schools may offer a more personalized learning experience, but often at a higher cost. In terms of **compulsory education**, students are required to attend school from the age of 5 to 16, with an additional two years of secondary education available for those who wish to pursue further studies. Overall, the education system in Saint Helena is designed to provide students with a well-rounded education and prepare them for future careers or further education.

[SECTION] School Fees [/SECTION]
[TABLE]
| School Type | Annual Fee (USD) | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Public Primary | $0 (free) | High-quality education, well-structured curriculum |
| Private Primary | $2,000-$5,000 | Smaller class sizes, more individualized attention |
| Public Secondary | $0 (free) | Wide range of subjects, including vocational training |
| Private Secondary | $5,000-$10,000 | More specialized courses, better resources |
| International School | N/A | No international schools available on the island |
[/TABLE]

[SECTION] University Tuition [/SECTION]
As there are no universities on the island of Saint Helena, students typically pursue higher education in the United Kingdom or other countries. However, some online or distance learning programs may be available.

| Institution Type | Annual Tuition - Local (USD) | Annual Tuition - International (USD) | Notes |

| Private University | N/A | $20,000-$35,000 | Tuition fees for private UK universities |
| Top-Ranked University | N/A | $25,000-$40,000 | Tuition fees for top-ranked UK universities |
[/TABLE]

[SECTION] Education Quality & Tips [/SECTION]
- The **public education system** in Saint Helena is generally considered to be of good quality, with a strong emphasis on core subjects.
- For **expat families**, the public education system may be a good option, as it is free or subsidized and offers a well-rounded education.
- **Scholarship opportunities** may be available for students pursuing higher education in the United Kingdom or other countries.
- **Online learning options** may be available for students who wish to pursue specialized courses or degrees not available on the island.
- The **education quality** in Saint Helena is comparable to other countries in the region, with a strong focus on providing students with a well-rounded education.
- For students who wish to pursue higher education, **applying to universities in the United Kingdom** may be a good option, as they offer a wide range of courses and have a strong reputation for academic excellence.
